P004106.project_name: Small and Medium Machinery Industry Project

keywords.cdata: alternative policies,Balance Sheets,Bank lending,Bank loans,Bank of Korea,bolts,Cash Flow Statements,commercial banks,comparative advantage,competitiveness,consolidation,debt,Developed Countries,Development Policies,development strategy,Economic Development,economic expansion,Economic Growth,employment,engines,equipment,equity investments,exports,Financial Institutions,financial resources,financial sector,financial strength,FISCAL YEAR,foreign exchange,GNP,Government intervention,growth rate,Imports,Income,income levels,Income Statements,industrialization,inefficiency,integrated approach,interest rate,interest rates,KDB,labor force,lathes,laws,Machinery,manufactured exports,Manufacturing,manufacturing enterprises,manufacturing industries,Manufacturing Sector,market mechanism,operating efficiency,per capita income,producers,Production Indexes,Production Technology,productivity,protectionism,quality standards,R&D,R&D projects,research institutes,resource allocation,resource use,Small Business,Structural Adjustment,Structural Change,subsidiary,Technical Assistance,trade policies,transport,value added,venture capital,wages

project_abstract.cdata: The proposed project provides a basis for improving the sectoral policies affecting the machinery industry sector, supports upgrading their technological capabilities, and provides credit for financing productive investments in the sector. It would consist of: (a) Technical Assistance: Institutional development for SMIPC to assist it in providing technical assistance to small and medium machinery producers to upgrade their skills and to improve their productivity in using existing technology at the plant level; (b) Training: On-the-job training for top managers and foremen in small and medium machinery enterprises to be provided by SMIPC and by other institutions through arrangements made by SMIPC; and (c) Credit: Lines of credit to SMIB, KLB and CNB, respectively, to finance the investment requirements of the small and medium machinery industry. About 660 individual enterprises would receive technical assistance under the project and about 3,300 managers, engineers and supervisors would be trained in manufacturing processes.
